subject: Re: New FAQ item? (Re: [junit] Textui.TestRunner regarding)
msgSnippet: Excellent. Thanks. *********** REPLY SEPARATOR  *********** ... the ... absolute ... its ... http://docs.yahoo.com/info/terms/ J. B. Rainsberger, President,
messageBody:
Excellent. Thanks.

*********** REPLY SEPARATOR ***********

On 2002-07-23 at 15:56 Mike Clark wrote:

>J. B. Rainsberger wrote:
>
>>Maybe this should be a FAQ item, if not already: common mistakes when
>>running the samples. Perhaps a polite reference to a tutorial
>>explaining what CLASSPATH is would be nice.
>>
>
>How's this work for ya?
>
>----
>
>Why do I get a NoClassDefFoundError when trying to test JUnit or run
the
>samples?
>
>(Submitted by: J.B. Rainsberger and Jason Rogers)
>
>Most likely your CLASSPATH doesn't include the JUnit installation
>directory.
>
>Consider running WhichJunit
><http://www.clarkware.com/software/WhichJUnit.zip> to print the
absolute
>location of the JUnit class files required to run and test JUnit and
its
>samples.
>
>If the CLASSPATH seems mysterious, read this
><http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.4/docs/tooldocs/findingclasses.html> !
>
>
>----
>
>Mike
>
>
>[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
